title: Variables
summary: Variables are named containers that store values in programming. They let you save data like numbers, text, or other information so you can reuse them throughout your code. Think of them as labeled boxes where you put things you want to remember and use later.
sample_question: What is a variable and why is it useful in programming?

title: Loops
summary: Loops are programming structures that repeat a set of instructions multiple times. There are two main types: for loops repeat a known number of times, while while loops repeat as long as a condition is true. Loops save you from writing the same code over and over.
sample_question: Explain the difference between a for loop and a while loop.

title: Functions
summary: Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform specific tasks. You define a function once with a name and parameters, then call it whenever you need that task done. Functions help organize code and avoid repetition.
sample_question: What is a function and how does it help organize your code?
